text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the s. 76(5A) householder defence threshold of 'grossly disproportionate' is not applicable to this street altercation. The response discusses self-defence in the context of a street altercation and focuses on the general reasonableness test under s. 3 CLA 1967 and common law principles (R v Williams, R v Palmer, R v Owino). By focusing on the general self-defence rules applicable to non-householder cases (where the test is 'reasonable force'), the response implicitly confirms that the higher 'grossly disproportionate' threshold specific to the s. 76(5A) householder defence is not the relevant standard for this street altercation.", "criterion_id": "2f43efa2-6cd5-48c6-b8fd-1035de7d7d10"}
